name: Tuberculosis
description: A bacterial infection that primarily affects the lungs and is highly prevalent in India.

name: Malaria
description: A mosquito-borne disease caused by Plasmodium parasites, common in tropical regions.

name: Dengue Fever
description: A viral infection transmitted by Aedes mosquitoes, leading to high fever and severe joint pain.

name: Chikungunya
description: A viral disease transmitted by mosquitoes, causing fever and severe joint pain.

name: Typhoid Fever
description: A bacterial infection spread through contaminated food and water, causing high fever and abdominal pain.

name: Hepatitis A
description: A viral liver disease transmitted through ingestion of contaminated food and water.

name: Hepatitis B
description: A serious liver infection caused by the hepatitis B virus, transmitted through bodily fluids.

name: Hepatitis C
description: A liver disease caused by the hepatitis C virus, often leading to chronic liver problems.

name: HIV/AIDS
description: A viral infection that attacks the immune system, leading to acquired immunodeficiency syndrome.

name: Leprosy
description: A chronic infectious disease causing skin lesions and nerve damage.

name: Kala Azar
description: Also known as visceral leishmaniasis, a parasitic disease transmitted by sandflies.

name: Japanese Encephalitis
description: A viral brain infection spread by mosquitoes, prevalent in rural areas.

name: Rabies
description: A fatal viral disease transmitted through animal bites, affecting the central nervous system.

name: Swine Flu
description: An influenza virus strain that originated in pigs and can infect humans.

name: Bird Flu
description: An avian influenza virus that can infect humans, leading to severe respiratory illness.

name: COVID-19
description: A respiratory illness caused by the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2.

name: Cholera
description: An acute diarrheal illness caused by ingestion of contaminated water or food.

name: Diarrheal Diseases
description: Infections causing frequent, watery bowel movements, leading to dehydration.

name: Pneumonia
description: An infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs.

name: Bronchitis
description: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes, often causing coughing and mucus production.

name: Asthma
description: A chronic respiratory condition characterized by airway inflammation and constriction.

name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
description: A group of lung diseases that block airflow and make breathing difficult.

name: Hypertension
description: A condition where the blood pressure in the arteries is persistently elevated.

name: Coronary Artery Disease
description: A disease caused by the buildup of plaque in the coronary arteries.

name: Stroke
description: A medical emergency where blood flow to the brain is interrupted.

name: Diabetes Mellitus Type 1
description: An autoimmune condition where the pancreas produces little or no insulin.

name: Diabetes Mellitus Type 2
description: A chronic condition affecting the way the body processes blood sugar.

name: Obesity
description: A condition characterized by excessive body fat increasing health risks.

name: Anemia
description: A condition where there's a lack of healthy red blood cells to carry oxygen.

name: Thalassemia
description: A genetic blood disorder causing the body to produce abnormal hemoglobin.

name: Sickle Cell Disease
description: A group of inherited red blood cell disorders affecting hemoglobin.

name: Cervical Cancer
description: A malignant tumor of the cervix, often caused by HPV infection.

name: Breast Cancer
description: A cancer that forms in the cells of the breasts.

name: Oral Cancer
description: Cancer that develops in the tissues of the mouth or throat.

name: Lung Cancer
description: A type of cancer that begins in the lungs, often linked to smoking.

name: Prostate Cancer
description: Cancer occurring in the prostate gland of men.

name: Skin Cancer
description: A cancer that forms in the tissues of the skin.

name: Liver Cancer
description: A cancer that begins in the cells of the liver.

name: Kidney Disease
description: A condition where the kidneys lose the ability to function properly.

name: Urinary Tract Infection
description: An infection in any part of the urinary system.

name: Gastroenteritis
description: An intestinal infection marked by diarrhea, cramps, nausea, and vomiting.

name: Peptic Ulcer Disease
description: Sores that develop on the lining of the stomach or small intestine.

name: Gallstones
description: Hardened deposits in the gallbladder causing pain and digestive issues.

name: Appendicitis
description: Inflammation of the appendix, often requiring surgical removal.

name: Pancreatitis
description: Inflammation of the pancreas, causing abdominal pain and digestive problems.

name: Hernia
description: A condition where an organ pushes through the muscle or tissue holding it in place.

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
description: An autoimmune disease causing inflammation in the joints.

name: Osteoarthritis
description: A degenerative joint disease affecting cartilage and bones.

name: Gout
description: A form of arthritis characterized by severe pain and tenderness in joints.

name: Lupus
description: A chronic autoimmune disease that can damage any part of the body.

name: Psoriasis
description: A skin disease causing red, itchy scaly patches, often on the knees, elbows, and scalp.

name: Eczema
description: An inflammatory skin condition causing redness, itching, and blisters.

name: Vitiligo
description: A condition in which the skin loses melanin, resulting in white patches.

name: Scabies
description: A contagious skin infestation caused by tiny mites burrowing into the skin.

name: Ringworm
description: A fungal infection of the skin causing a red, circular rash with clearer skin in the middle.

name: Conjunctivitis
description: An eye infection causing redness, swelling, and discharge from the eyes.

name: Cataract
description: A clouding of the eye's natural lens, affecting vision.

name: Glaucoma
description: A group of eye diseases causing optic nerve damage and vision loss.

name: Migraine
description: A neurological condition causing intense headaches and sensory disturbances.

name: Epilepsy
description: A central nervous system disorder marked by abnormal brain activity and seizures.

name: Parkinson's Disease
description: A progressive nervous system disorder affecting movement and coordination.

name: Alzheimer's Disease
description: A progressive brain disorder causing memory loss and cognitive decline.

name: Depression
description: A common mental disorder affecting mood, thoughts, and behavior.

name: Anxiety Disorders
description: Mental health conditions marked by excessive worry and fear.

name: Bipolar Disorder
description: A mental illness causing extreme mood swings, including emotional highs and lows.

name: Schizophrenia
description: A severe mental disorder affecting a personâ€™s thoughts, feelings, and behavior.

name: Autism Spectrum Disorder
description: A developmental disorder affecting communication and behavior.

name: ADHD
description: A neurodevelopmental disorder marked by inattention, hyperactivity, and impulsivity.

name: Polio
description: A viral disease that may cause paralysis and muscle weakness.

name: Measles
description: A highly contagious viral disease with symptoms like fever and skin rash.

name: Mumps
description: A viral infection causing swelling in the salivary glands.

name: Rubella
description: A contagious viral infection preventable by vaccine, also known as German measles.

name: Tetanus
description: A bacterial infection causing muscle stiffness and spasms.

name: Whooping Cough
description: A contagious bacterial infection causing severe coughing fits.

name: H1N1 Influenza
description: A strain of influenza virus that caused a global pandemic in 2009.

name: Zika Virus Infection
description: A mosquito-borne virus that can cause birth defects if contracted during pregnancy.

name: Filariasis
description: A parasitic disease transmitted by mosquitoes causing swelling of limbs.

name: Toxoplasmosis
description: An infection caused by a parasite, often contracted from undercooked meat or cat feces.

name: Typhus
description: A bacterial disease spread by lice or fleas, causing fever and rash.

name: Brucellosis
description: A bacterial infection transmitted from animals to humans through unpasteurized dairy.

name: Scrub Typhus
description: A disease caused by bacteria spread through mite bites, common in rural areas.

name: Hantavirus
description: A virus spread by rodents causing severe respiratory disease in humans.

name: Hydatid Disease
description: A parasitic infection caused by tapeworms, commonly affecting liver and lungs.

name: Ascariasis
description: A parasitic worm infection of the small intestine, prevalent in poor sanitation areas.

name: Hookworm Infection
description: A parasitic infection causing blood loss and anemia, common in tropical regions.

name: Tapeworm Infection
description: A parasitic infection caused by ingesting tapeworm larvae or eggs.

name: Giardiasis
description: A diarrheal disease caused by a microscopic parasite.

name: Scurvy
description: A vitamin C deficiency disease causing weakness and gum disease.

name: Rickets
description: A childhood bone disorder caused by vitamin D deficiency.

name: Goiter
description: An abnormal enlargement of the thyroid gland often due to iodine deficiency.

name: Beriberi
description: A disease caused by thiamine (vitamin B1) deficiency, affecting the nervous system.
